Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அற்றாரைத் தேறுதல் ஓம்புக மற்றவர் பற்றிலர் நாணார் பழி.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Let (a king) avoid choosing men who have no relations; such men have no attachment, and therefore have no fear of crime.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A lone individual, depicted as a solitary, uprooted tree with no roots connecting to the ground ('அற்றார்'). They are being offered a position of trust.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Because they have no roots (no attachments or kin - 'பற்றிலர்'), they are shown carelessly committing a shameful act ('பழி'), as they have no fear of bringing disgrace to a family or community ('நாணார் பழி').
Layered_Composition.Background: In contrast, other 'trees' in the background are shown with deep, interconnected root systems (representing family and community), and they stand firm and upright, avoiding shameful acts.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A warning against trusting those who are without attachments or relations, as they will not have the fear of shame that prevents wrongdoing.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The uprooted, rootless tree is a powerful metaphor for a person without attachments. The interconnected root system of the other trees represents the stabilizing influence of kinship.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The rootless tree is in a harsh, isolated light, against a barren patch of ground. The other trees are in a healthier, more integrated environment. The color palette is stark to show the contrast.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide shot that emphasizes the isolation of the rootless tree compared to the community of rooted trees.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that isolates the untrustworthy figure.

Cultural_Anchors: Having no fear of disgrace ('நாணார் பழி')
